Class BoardContentPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class BoardContentPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.GridPane
    Represents the content of the board
    Author:
    Adriana Ferrari

      • enqueueWeapon

        private void enqueueWeapon​(java.lang.String weaponName,
                           java.lang.String[] names,
                           java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> adder,
                           java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> queue)
        Adds a new weapon if possible, otherwise it enqueues it
        Parameters:
        weaponName - the name of the weapon to enqueue
        names - the array containing the neighboring weapons
        adder - the biconsumer that will take care of adding the weapon to its correct place
        queue - the queue to which the weapon should be added if there is no place available

      • removePreviousElementIfPresent

        private void removePreviousElementIfPresent​(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane[] containerGroup,
                                            java.lang.String[] previousContentNames,
                                            int index,
                                            java.lang.String newName)
        Removes the old weapon if it is still there and puts the name of a new weapon in its place
        Parameters:
        containerGroup - the array with the container of the new weapon
        previousContentNames - the array with the names of the weapons that are stored in that container
        index - the index at which the element will be added
        newName - the name of the new weapon

      • addWeapon

        private void addWeapon​(java.lang.String weaponName,
                       double rotation,
                       int row,
                       int col,
                       javafx.scene.layout.GridPane container)
        Physically adds a weapon to the screen
        Parameters:
        weaponName - the name of the weapon to add
        rotation - the rotation of the image
        row - the row at which it should be added
        col - the column at which it should be added
        container - the container to which it should be added

      • removeWeapon

        private void removeWeapon​(java.lang.String weaponName,
                          java.lang.String[] names,
                          javafx.scene.layout.GridPane[] containers,
                          java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> queue,
                          java.util.function.BiConsumer<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> adder)
        Removes a weapon from its container
        Parameters:
        weaponName - the weapon that shall be removed
        names - the names of its neighboring weapons (and its name)
        containers - the containers of its neighboring weapons (and itself)
        queue - the queue from which to poll a replacement
        adder - the biconsumer to call if the replacement is found

      • removeWeaponTop

        public void removeWeaponTop​(java.lang.String weaponName)
        Removes a weapon from the top container

      • waitForBlockSelection

        public void waitForBlockSelection​(java.util.List<java.awt.Point> availableCoordinates,
                                  java.util.function.Consumer<java.awt.Point> consumer,
                                  javafx.scene.text.Text message)
        Sets up the board so that it can detect the selection of a block
        Parameters:
        availableCoordinates - the points that can be selected
        consumer - the consumer that will be called after the selection of a block
        message - the message that is being showed to the user during the selection

                            javafx.scene.text.Text message)

        selectable - the blocks that can be affected by this event
